p: However, the area below this unknown part of the heat flow contributes to the total specific precipitation heat transformed by an unknown value, ∆ H dead. To minimize the error of the total specific precipitation heat, an approximation of the missing ∆ H dead by a triangle area is suggested ( Figure 7). Related to the overall precipitation heat, ∆ H dead has an average value of 1.6% and a maximal value of 7.5%. For the characterization of the precipitation kinetics in the isothermal time-temperature-precipitation diagram, the values of 10%, 50% and 90% of the observed total specific precipitation heat were chosen.
